Tim Decloniemaclennan

Product Designer, Researcher, and Accessibility Specialist

I am experienced in leveraging agile frameworks to provide a robust synopsis for high level overviews. Iterative approaches to corporate strategy foster collaborative thinking to further the overall value proposition.

Experience

Product Designer

Blue Cross and Blue Shield

I work on creating new and improving existing experiences for both external consumers and internal customer advocates. I engage business needs using research methodologies to understand and reframe complex problems; then create solutions using design. My responsibilities include: creating and conducting user research, creating prototypes, wireframing, heuristic evaluations, stakeholder management and engagement, and providing accessibility guidance to the business and fellow designers.

July 2019 - Present

User Experience Intern

Michigan Multimedia

Michigan Multimedia designs and researches websites for the University of Michigan's Medical Schools. As an intern, I was responsible for designing wireframes, creating webpages using Drupal, conducting user interviews, creating sureys, and conducting heuristic evaluations. Additionally, provided accessibility guidance to UX Designers and Researchers.

June 2018 - December 2018

UX Researcher & Accessibility Specialist

General Motors

Worked as a User Research on the in-vehicle user experience team, where I was responsible for conducting UX research on their in-vehicle touchscreen system, Infotainment 3.0. Research responsibilities included conducting usability testing, user interviews, heuristic evaluations, contextual inquiry, and comparative analysis. Additionally provided accessibility guidance to UX Designers.

July 2015 - July 2016

User Experience Intern

Usability/Accessibility Research & Consulting (UARC)

Collaboratively administrate empowered markets via plug-and-play networks. Dynamically procrastinate B2C users after installed base benefits. Dramatically visualize customer directed convergence without revolutionary ROI.

December 2013 - May 2015
